descriptions: No understanding of power series or convergence is demonstrated.
Struggles to define power series and convergence; significant errors present.
Demonstrates partial understanding; can define power series but struggles with convergence.
Defines power series and convergence with minor inaccuracies; demonstrates some computation ability.
Clearly defines power series and convergence; computes the radius of convergence with occasional errors.
Exemplary definition of power series and convergence; accurately computes the radius of convergence in all cases.
No attempt to apply convergence tests.
Attempts convergence tests but applies them incorrectly or without justification.
Applies convergence tests with significant errors; struggles to justify test selection.
Selects and applies appropriate convergence tests with minor calculation errors.
Applies convergence tests accurately and provides reasonable justification for test selection.
Masterful application of convergence tests; provides clear, concise, and correct justifications for each test selected.
No attempt to calculate the radius of convergence.
Attempts to calculate the radius of convergence but demonstrates no understanding of the limit process.
Calculates the radius of convergence but makes critical errors in the limit process.
Calculates the radius of convergence with minor errors in algebra or limit evaluation.
Accurately calculates the radius of convergence for basic power series.
Consistently and accurately calculates the radius of convergence for a wide range of power series, including complex cases.
